data.body:
we are seeing dozens of these calls:

 GET /api/beads/foolery-vdk0.5/deps?_repo=%2FUsers%2Fcartine%2Ffoolery 200 in 713ms (compile: 1494µs, render: 711ms)
 GET /api/beads/foolery-xmg8/deps?_repo=%2FUsers%2Fcartine%2Ffoolery 200 in 714ms (compile: 669µs, render: 714ms)
 GET /api/beads/foolery-xmg8.1/deps?_repo=%2FUsers%2Fcartine%2Ffoolery 200 in 716ms (compile: 924µs, render: 715ms)
 GET /api/beads/foolery-xmg8.2/deps?_repo=%2FUsers%2Fcartine%2Ffoolery 200 in 718ms (compile: 1331µs, render: 716ms)
 GET /api/beads/foolery-xmg8.3/deps?_repo=%2FUsers%2Fcartine%2Ffoolery 200 in 709ms (compile: 723µs, render: 708ms)
 GET /api/beads/foolery-xmg8.4/deps?_repo=%2FUsers%2Fcartine%2Ffoolery

and many, many more with a single issue per get call.

can we not have a batch call and limit it only to beats that are actually visible in the last - child beats are more typically folded/hidden.  we can trigger a full request on page load and a full request on an unfold action.  but this should really be one batch call.
